'''Wisdom''' is having gained knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding, along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/wisdom ''wisdom''], [http://en.wiktionary.org Wiktionary]</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
 
'''Wisdom''' is having gained knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding, along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/wisdom ''wisdom''], [http://en.wiktionary.org Wiktionary]</ref> To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings.
    −
liltoyntia l jones is a wise woman of God. as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources. Some define wisdom in a [[utilitarian]] sense, as foreseeing consequences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
+
Some see wisdom as a quality that even a child, otherwise immature, may possess independently of experience or wide knowledge. The status of wisdom or prudence as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources. Some define wisdom in a [[utilitarian]] sense, as foreseeing consequences and acting to maximize the long-term common [[goodness|good]].{{Fact|date=March 2007}} As such, wisdom is viewed as consisting of ideals and principles that govern all actions and decisions.
